member.name: F:SharpMap.Map.DisposeLayersOnDispose
member.summary:
Specifies wether to trigger a dispose on all layers (and their datasources) contained in this map when the map-object is disposed. The default behaviour is true unless the map is a result of a Map.Clone() operation in which case the value is false
If you reuse your datasources or layers between many map-objects you should set this property to false in order for them to keep existing after a map.dispose()

member.name: P:SharpMap.Map.MapTransform
member.summary: Using the you can alter the coordinate system of the map rendering. This makes it possible to rotate or rescale the image, for instance to have another direction than north upwards.
member.example:
Rotate the map output 45 degrees around its center:
System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix maptransform = new System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix(); //Create transformation matrix maptransform.RotateAt(45,new PointF(myMap.Size.Width/2,myMap.Size.Height/2)); //Apply 45 degrees rotation around the center of the map myMap.MapTransform = maptransform; //Apply transformation to map

member.summary: Request is for a Layer in a Style not offered by the server.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiSurface
member.summary: A MultiSurface is a two-dimensional geometric collection whose elements are surfaces. The interiors of any two surfaces in a MultiSurface may not intersect. The boundaries of any two elements in a MultiSurface may intersect at most at a finite number of points.
member.remarks: MultiSurface is a non-instantiable class in this specification, it defines a set of methods for its subclasses and is included for reasons of extensibility. The instantiable subclass of MultiSurface is MultiPolygon, corresponding to a collection of Polygons.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryCollection
member.summary: A GeometryCollection is a geometry that is a collection of 1 or more geometries.
member.remarks:
All the elements in a GeometryCollection must be in the same Spatial Reference. This is also the Spatial Reference for the GeometryCollection.
GeometryCollection places no other constraints on its elements. Subclasses of GeometryCollection may restrict membership based on dimension and may also place other constraints on the degree of spatial overlap between elements.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Geometries.Geometry
member.summary: is the root class of the Geometry Object Model hierarchy. is an abstract (non-instantiable) class.

remarks.para: The instantiable subclasses of defined in the specification are restricted to 0, 1 and twodimensional geometric objects that exist in two-dimensional coordinate space (R^2).

All instantiable geometry classes described in this specification are defined so that valid instances of a geometry class are topologically closed (i.e. all defined geometries include their boundary).

member.name: M:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryCollection.Boundary
member.summary: Returns the closure of the combinatorial boundary of this Geometry. The combinatorial boundary is defined as described in section 3.12.3.2 of [1]. Because the result of this function is a closure, and hence topologically closed, the resulting boundary can be represented using representational geometry primitives
member.returns: Closure of the combinatorial boundary of this Geometry

member.name: T:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2
member.summary: Enumeration of Simple Features Geometry types

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.Geometry
member.summary: Geometry is the root class of the hierarchy. Geometry is an abstract (non-instantiable) class.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.Point
member.summary: A Point is a 0-dimensional geometry and represents a single location in coordinate space.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.Curve
member.summary: A curve is a one-dimensional geometric object usually stored as a sequence of points, with the subtype of curve specifying the form of the interpolation between points.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.LineString
member.summary: A LineString is a curve with linear interpolation between points. Each consecutive pair of points defines a line segment.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.Surface
member.summary: A Surface is a two-dimensional geometric object.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.Polygon
member.summary: A Polygon is a planar surface, defined by 1 exterior boundary and 0 or more interior boundaries. Each interior boundary defines a hole in the polygon.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.GeometryCollection
member.summary: A GeometryCollection is a geometry that is a collection of 1 or more geometries.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.MultiPoint
member.summary: A MultiPoint is a 0 dimensional geometric collection. The elements of a MultiPoint are restricted to Points. The points are not connected or ordered.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.MultiCurve
member.summary: A MultiCurve is a one-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Curves.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.MultiLineString
member.summary: A MultiLineString is a MultiCurve whose elements are LineStrings.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.MultiSurface
member.summary: A MultiSurface is a two-dimensional geometric collection whose elements are surfaces. The interiors of any two surfaces in a MultiSurface may not intersect. The boundaries of any two elements in a MultiSurface may intersect at most at a finite number of points.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Geometries.GeometryType2.MultiPolygon
member.summary: A MultiPolygon is a MultiSurface whose elements are Polygons.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.WKBGeometryType
member.summary: Enumeration to determine geometrytype in Well-known Binary

member.name: T:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.GeometryToWKB
member.summary: Converts a instance to a Well-known Binary string representation.

remarks.para: The Well-known Binary Representation for (WKBGeometry) provides a portable representation of a value as a contiguous stream of bytes. It permits values to be exchanged between an ODBC client and an SQL database in binary form.

The Well-known Binary Representation for is obtained by serializing a instance as a sequence of numeric types drawn from the set {Unsigned Integer, Double} and then serializing each numeric type as a sequence of bytes using one of two well defined, standard, binary representations for numeric types (NDR, XDR). The specific binary encoding (NDR or XDR) used for a geometry byte stream is described by a one byte tag that precedes the serialized bytes. The only difference between the two encodings of geometry is one of byte order, the XDR encoding is Big Endian, the NDR encoding is Little Endian.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.GeometryToWKB.Write(SharpMap.Geometries.Geometry)
member.summary: Writes a geometry to a byte array using little endian byte encoding

member.summary: Writes a geometry to a byte array using the specified encoding.

member.summary: Writes an unsigned integer to the binarywriter using the specified encoding

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.GeometryToWKB.WriteDouble(System.Double,System.IO.BinaryWriter,SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.WkbByteOrder)
member.summary: Writes a double to the binarywriter using the specified encoding

member.param: The geometry to determine the type of.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.WFS
member.summary: WFS dataprovider This provider can be used to obtain data from an OGC Web Feature Service. It performs the following requests: 'GetCapabilities', 'DescribeFeatureType' and 'GetFeature'. This class is optimized for performing requests to GeoServer (http://geoserver.org). Supported geometries are: - PointPropertyType - LineStringPropertyType - PolygonPropertyType - CurvePropertyType - SurfacePropertyType - MultiPointPropertyType - MultiLineStringPropertyType - MultiPolygonPropertyType - MultiCurvePropertyType - MultiSurfacePropertyType

member.summary: Use this constructor for initializing this dataprovider with all mandatory metadata for retrieving a featuretype, so that 'GetCapabilities' and 'DescribeFeatureType' can be bypassed.
member.param: Use an empty string or 'null', if there is no prefix for the featuretype.
Use an empty string or 'null', if there is no namespace for the featuretype. You don't need to know the namespace of the feature type, if you use the quick geometries option.
Specifying the geometry type helps to accelerate the rendering process.

member.summary: Use this constructor for initializing this dataprovider with all necessary parameters to gather metadata from 'GetCapabilities' contract.
member.param: This cache (obtained from an already instantiated dataprovider that retrieves a featuretype hosted by the same service) helps to speed up gathering metadata. It caches the 'GetCapabilities' response.
Use an empty string or 'null', if there is no prefix for the featuretype.
Specifying the geometry type helps to accelerate the rendering process, if the geometry type in 'DescribeFeatureType is unprecise.

member.summary: This method gets metadata about the featuretype to query from 'GetCapabilities' and 'DescribeFeatureType'.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.WFS.GetCapabilitiesCache
member.summary: This cache (obtained from an already instantiated dataprovider that retrieves a featuretype hosted by the same service) helps to speed up gathering metadata. It caches the 'GetCapabilities' response.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.WFS.FeatureTypeInfo
member.summary: Gets feature metadata

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.WFS.QuickGeometries
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether extracting geometry information from 'GetFeature' response shall be done quickly without paying attention to context validation, polygon boundaries and multi-geometries. This option accelerates the geometry parsing process, but in scarce cases can lead to errors.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.WFS.MultiGeometries
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the 'GetFeature' parser should ignore multi-geometries (MultiPoint, MultiLineString, MultiCurve, MultiPolygon, MultiSurface). By default it does not. Ignoring multi-geometries can lead to a better performance.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.WFS.GetFeatureGETRequest
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the 'GetFeature' request should be done with HTTP GET. This option can be important when obtaining data from a WFS provided by an UMN MapServer.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.WFS.ConnectionID

member.name: T:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer
member.summary: The StreamTokenizer class takes an input stream and parses it into "tokens", allowing the tokens to be read one at a time. The parsing process is controlled by a table and a number of flags that can be set to various states. The stream tokenizer can recognize identifiers, numbers, quoted strings, and various comment style
member.remarks: This is a crude c# implementation of Java's StreamTokenizer class.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.#ctor(System.IO.TextReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the StreamTokenizer class.
member.param: A TextReader with some text to read.
Flag indicating whether whitespace should be ignored.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.GetNumericValue
member.summary: If the current token is a number, this field contains the value of that number.
member.remarks: If the current token is a number, this field contains the value of that number. The current token is a number when the value of the ttype field is TT_NUMBER.
member.exception: Current token is not a number in a valid format.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.GetStringValue
member.summary: If the current token is a word token, this field contains a string giving the characters of the word token.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.GetTokenType
member.summary: Gets the token type of the current token.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.NextToken(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the next token.
member.param: Determines is whitespace is ignored. True if whitespace is to be ignored.
member.returns: The TokenType of the next token.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.NextToken
member.summary: Returns the next token.
member.returns: The TokenType of the next token.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.GetType(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines a characters type (e.g. number, symbols, character).

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.NextNonWhitespaceToken
member.summary: Returns next token that is not whitespace.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.LineNumber
member.summary: The current line number of the stream being read.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.IO.StreamTokenizer.Column
member.summary: The current column number of the stream being read.

Linestyles that cannot be created with available -properties
Warping Text to curves
...

member.summary:
Displays Disclaimer-information as on maps.google.com
To be used when using Google Maps as BaseMap via for example BruTile Calls ViewPortInfo Service at maps.google.com to get information about DisclaimerText
Supports Async-Mode (use special .ctor)

Initialize with custom parameters
IMPORTANT: In Async mode you need to use UpdateBoundingBox when the MapBox/MapImage center or ZoomLevel changes, else the text will be wrong

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.OleDbPoint
member.summary: The OleDbPoint provider is used for rendering point data from an OleDb compatible datasource.

remarks.para: The data source will need to have two double-type columns, xColumn and yColumn that contains the coordinates of the point, and an integer-type column containing a unique identifier for each row.
To get good performance, make sure you have applied indexes on ID, xColumn and yColumns in your datasource table.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Layers.LabelLayer.LabelStringDelegate
member.summary: Gets or sets the method for creating a custom label string based on a feature.

remarks.para: If this method is not null, it will override the value.
The label delegate must take a and return a string.
remarks.example:
Creating a label-text by combining attributes "ROADNAME" and "STATE" into one string, using an anonymous delegate:
myLabelLayer.LabelStringDelegate = delegate(SharpMap.Data.FeatureDataRow fdr) { return fdr["ROADNAME"].ToString() + ", " + fdr["STATE"].ToString(); };

member.name: P:SharpMap.Layers.LabelLayer.LabelPositionDelegate
member.summary: Gets or sets the method for creating a custom position based on a feature.

remarks.para: If this method is not null, it will override the position based on the centroid of the boundingbox of the feature
The label delegate must take a and return a SharpMap.Geometries.Point.
If the delegate returns a null, the centroid of the feature will be used
remarks.example:
Creating a custom position by using X and Y values from the FeatureDataRow attributes "LabelX" and "LabelY", using an anonymous delegate:
myLabelLayer.LabelPositionDelegate = delegate(SharpMap.Data.FeatureDataRow fdr) { return new SharpMap.Geometries.Point(Convert.ToDouble(fdr["LabelX"]), Convert.ToDouble(fdr["LabelY"]));};

member.name: P:SharpMap.Layers.LabelLayer.PriorityDelegate
member.summary: Gets or sets the method for calculating the render priority of a label based on a feature.

remarks.para: If this method is not null, it will override the value.
The label delegate must take a and return an Int32.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Geometries.Polygon
member.summary: A Polygon is a planar Surface, defined by 1 exterior boundary and 0 or more interior boundaries. Each interior boundary defines a hole in the Polygon.
member.remarks: Vertices of rings defining holes in polygons are in the opposite direction of the exterior ring.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Geometries.Surface
member.summary: A Surface is a two-dimensional geometric object.
member.remarks: The OpenGIS Abstract Specification defines a simple Surface as consisting of a single patch that is associated with one exterior boundary and 0 or more interior boundaries. Simple surfaces in threedimensional space are isomorphic to planar surfaces. Polyhedral surfaces are formed by stitching together simple surfaces along their boundaries, polyhedral surfaces in three-dimensional space may not be planar as a whole.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType
member.summary: Shapefile geometry type.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.Null
member.summary: Null shape with no geometric data

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.Point
member.summary: A point consists of a pair of double-precision coordinates. SharpMap interpretes this as

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.PolyLine
member.summary: PolyLine is an ordered set of vertices that consists of one or more parts. A part is a connected sequence of two or more points. Parts may or may not be connected to one another. Parts may or may not intersect one another. SharpMap interpretes this as either or

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.Polygon
member.summary: A polygon consists of one or more rings. A ring is a connected sequence of four or more points that form a closed, non-self-intersecting loop. A polygon may contain multiple outer rings. The order of vertices or orientation for a ring indicates which side of the ring is the interior of the polygon. The neighborhood to the right of an observer walking along the ring in vertex order is the neighborhood inside the polygon. Vertices of rings defining holes in polygons are in a counterclockwise direction. Vertices for a single, ringed polygon are, therefore, always in clockwise order. The rings of a polygon are referred to as its parts. SharpMap interpretes this as either or

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.Multipoint
member.summary: A MultiPoint represents a set of points. SharpMap interpretes this as

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.PointZ
member.summary: A PointZ consists of a triplet of double-precision coordinates plus a measure. SharpMap interpretes this as

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.PolyLineZ
member.summary: A PolyLineZ consists of one or more parts. A part is a connected sequence of two or more points. Parts may or may not be connected to one another. Parts may or may not intersect one another. SharpMap interpretes this as or

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.PolygonZ
member.summary: A PolygonZ consists of a number of rings. A ring is a closed, non-self-intersecting loop. A PolygonZ may contain multiple outer rings. The rings of a PolygonZ are referred to as its parts. SharpMap interpretes this as either or

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.MultiPointZ
member.summary: A MultiPointZ represents a set of s. SharpMap interpretes this as

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.PointM
member.summary: A PointM consists of a pair of double-precision coordinates in the order X, Y, plus a measure M. SharpMap interpretes this as

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.PolyLineM
member.summary: A shapefile PolyLineM consists of one or more parts. A part is a connected sequence of two or more points. Parts may or may not be connected to one another. Parts may or may not intersect one another. SharpMap interpretes this as or

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.PolygonM
member.summary: A PolygonM consists of a number of rings. A ring is a closed, non-self-intersecting loop. SharpMap interpretes this as either or

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.MultiPointM
member.summary: A MultiPointM represents a set of s. SharpMap interpretes this as

member.name: F:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeType.MultiPatch
member.summary: A MultiPatch consists of a number of surface patches. Each surface patch describes a surface. The surface patches of a MultiPatch are referred to as its parts, and the type of part controls how the order of vertices of an MultiPatch part is interpreted. SharpMap doesn't support this feature type.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile
member.summary: Shapefile dataprovider

remarks.para: The ShapeFile provider is used for accessing ESRI ShapeFiles. The ShapeFile should at least contain the [filename].shp, [filename].idx, and if feature-data is to be used, also [filename].dbf file.

The first time the ShapeFile is accessed, SharpMap will automatically create a spatial index of the shp-file, and save it as [filename].shp.sidx. If you change or update the contents of the .shp file, delete the .sidx file to force SharpMap to rebuilt it. In web applications, the index will automatically be cached to memory for faster access, so to reload the index, you will need to restart the web application as well.
M and Z values in a shapefile is ignored by SharpMap.

member.summary: Tree used for fast query of data

member.summary: Cleans the internal memory cached, expurging the objects that are not in the viewarea anymore
member.param: OID of the objects in the current viewarea

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a ShapeFile DataProvider.

remarks.para: If FileBasedIndex is true, the spatial index will be read from a local copy. If it doesn't exist, it will be generated and saved to [filename] + '.sidx'.
Using a file-based index is especially recommended for ASP.NET applications which will speed up start-up time when the cache has been emptied.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a ShapeFile DataProvider.

remarks.para: If FileBasedIndex is true, the spatial index will be read from a local copy. If it doesn't exist, it will be generated and saved to [filename] + '.sidx'.
Using a file-based index is especially recommended for ASP.NET applications which will speed up start-up time when the cache has been emptied.

member.param: Use the memory cache. BEWARE in case of large shapefiles

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.GetGeometriesInView(SharpMap.Geometries.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Returns geometries whose bounding box intersects 'bbox'

remarks.para: Please note that this method doesn't guarantee that the geometries returned actually intersect 'bbox', but only that their boundingbox intersects 'bbox'.
This method is much faster than the QueryFeatures method, because intersection tests are performed on objects simplifed by their boundingbox, and using the Spatial Index.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.ExecuteIntersectionQuery(SharpMap.Geometries.BoundingBox,SharpMap.Data.FeatureDataSet)
member.summary: Returns all objects whose boundingbox intersects bbox.

remarks.para: Please note that this method doesn't guarantee that the geometries returned actually intersect 'bbox', but only that their boundingbox intersects 'bbox'.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.GetObjectIDsInView(SharpMap.Geometries.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Returns geometry Object IDs whose bounding box intersects 'bbox'

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.GetGeometryByID(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Returns the geometry corresponding to the Object ID

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.ExecuteIntersectionQuery(SharpMap.Geometries.Geometry,SharpMap.Data.FeatureDataSet)
member.summary: Returns the data associated with all the geometries that are intersected by 'geom'. Please note that the ShapeFile provider currently doesn't fully support geometryintersection and thus only BoundingBox/BoundingBox querying are performed. The results are NOT guaranteed to lie withing 'geom'.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.PopulateIndexes
member.summary: If an index file is present (.shx) it reads the record offsets from the .shx index file and returns the information in an array. IfF an indexd array is not present it works out the indexes from the data file, by going through the record headers, finding the data lengths and workingout the offsets. Which ever method is used a array of index is popuated to be use by the other methods. This array is created when the open method is called, and removed when the close method called.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.CoordinateSystem
member.summary: Gets or sets the coordinate system of the ShapeFile. If a shapefile has a corresponding [filename].prj file containing a Well-Known Text description of the coordinate system this will automatically be read. If this is not the case, the coordinate system will default to null.
member.exception: An exception is thrown if the coordinate system is read from file.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.ShapeType
member.summary: Gets the shape geometry type in this shapefile.
member.remarks:
The property isn't set until the first time the datasource has been opened, and will throw an exception if this property has been called since initialization.
All the non-Null shapes in a shapefile are required to be of the same shape type.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.Filename
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename of the shapefile
member.remarks: If the filename changes, indexes will be rebuilt

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding used for parsing strings from the DBase DBF file.
member.remarks: The DBase default encoding is .

member.name: P:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.FilterDelegate
member.summary: Filter Delegate Method for limiting the datasource

remarks.example:
Using an anonymous method for filtering all features where the NAME column starts with S:
myShapeDataSource.FilterDelegate = new SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.FilterMethod(delegate(SharpMap.Data.FeatureDataRow row) { return (!row["NAME"].ToString().StartsWith("S")); });

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.ShapeFile.FilterMethod
member.summary: Filter Delegate Method
member.remarks:
The FilterMethod delegate is used for applying a method that filters data from the dataset. The method should return 'true' if the feature should be included and false if not.
See the property for more info
member.returns: true if this feature should be included, false if it should be filtered

member.name: M:SharpMap.Web.Wms.Tiling.TileExtents.CheckForBounds(SharpMap.Geometries.BoundingBox,SharpMap.Geometries.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Checks if the tile with given extent is within the bounds given by the TileSet BoundingBox. It is not a normal Within operation however because the extent can be partially outside to the top right but not outside of the bottom left. That is how it is defined in WMS-C.
member.returns: Returns true if the tile with this extent is part of the tile collection on the server

member.name: M:SharpMap.Utilities.Wfs.WfsFeatureTypeInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,SharpMap.Utilities.Wfs.GeometryTypeEnum)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Use an empty string or 'null', if there is no prefix for the featuretype.
Use an empty string or 'null', if there is no namespace for the featuretype. You don't need to know the namespace of the feature type, if you use the quick geometries option.

The geometry name is the property of the featuretype from which geometry information can be obtained from. Usually this property is called something like 'Shape' or 'geom'. It is absolutely necessary to give this parameter.
Specifying the geometry type helps to accelerate the rendering process.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Use an empty string or 'null', if there is no namespace for the featuretype. You don't need to know the namespace of the feature type, if you use the quick geometries option.

The geometry name is the property of the featuretype from which geometry information can be obtained from. Usually this property is called something like 'Shape' or 'geom'. It is absolutely necessary to give this parameter.

member.remarks: This property is an array of structures that represents the colors to use at corresponding positions along a gradient. Along with the Positions property, this property defines a multicolor gradient.

member.name: P:SharpMap.Rendering.Thematics.ColorBlend.Positions
member.summary: Gets or sets the positions along a gradient line.
member.value: An array of values that specify percentages of distance along the gradient line.

remarks.para: The elements of this array specify percentages of distance along the gradient line. For example, an element value of 0.2f specifies that this point is 20 percent of the total distance from the starting point. The elements in this array are represented by float values between 0.0f and 1.0f, and the first element of the array must be 0.0f and the last element must be 1.0f.
remarks.pre: Along with the Colors property, this property defines a multicolor gradient.

member.summary: Gets a linear gradient scale with seven colours making a rainbow from red to violet.
member.remarks: Colors span the following with an interval of 1/6: { Color.Red, Color.Orange, Color.Yellow, Color.Green, Color.Blue, Color.Indigo, Color.Violet }

member.summary: Compute the projection factor for the projection of the point p onto this LineSegment. The projection factor is the constant k by which the vector for this segment must be multiplied to equal the vector for the projection of p.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Rendering.Thematics.GradientTheme
member.summary: The GradientTheme class defines a gradient color thematic rendering of features based by a numeric attribute.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Rendering.Thematics.GradientTheme.#ctor(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,SharpMap.Styles.IStyle,SharpMap.Styles.IStyle)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GradientTheme class

remarks.para: The gradient theme interpolates linearly between two styles based on a numerical attribute in the datasource. This is useful for scaling symbols, line widths, line and fill colors from numerical attributes.
Colors are interpolated between two colors, but if you want to interpolate through more colors (fx. a rainbow), set the , and properties to a custom .

The following properties are scaled (properties not mentioned here are not interpolated):
PropertyRemarks
Red, Green, Blue and Alpha values are linearly interpolated.
The color, width, color of pens are interpolated. MiterLimit,StartCap,EndCap,LineJoin,DashStyle,DashPattern,DashOffset,DashCap,CompoundArray, and Alignment are switched in the middle of the min/max values.
SolidBrush color are interpolated. Other brushes are not supported.
MaxVisible, MinVisible, Line, Outline, Fill and SymbolScale are scaled linearly. Symbol, EnableOutline and Enabled switch in the middle of the min/max values.
FontSize, BackColor, ForeColor, MaxVisible, MinVisible, Offset are scaled linearly. All other properties use min-style.

member.param: Name of column to extract the attribute

member.name: P:SharpMap.Rendering.Thematics.GradientTheme.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets or sets the column name from where to get the attribute value

member.name: F:SharpMap.Web.Wms.Capabilities.WmsServiceDescription.Abstract
member.summary: Optional narrative description providing additional information

summary.para: The optional element "AccessConstraints" may be omitted if it do not apply to the server. If the element is present, the reserved word "none" (case-insensitive) shall be used if there are no access constraints, as follows: "none".
When constraints are imposed, no precise syntax has been defined for the text content of these elements, but client applications may display the content for user information and action.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT
member.summary: Converts a Well-known Text representation to a instance.
member.remarks:
The Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of Geometry is designed to exchange geometry data in ASCII form. Examples of WKT representations of geometry objects are:
Geometry WKT Representation
A Point POINT(15 20)
Note that point coordinates are specified with no separating comma.
A LineString with four points: LINESTRING(0 0, 10 10, 20 25, 50 60)
A Polygon with one exterior ring and one interior ring: POLYGON((0 0,10 0,10 10,0 10,0 0),(5 5,7 5,7 7,5 7, 5 5))
A MultiPoint with three Point values: MULTIPOINT(0 0, 20 20, 60 60)
A MultiLineString with two LineString values: MULTILINESTRING((10 10, 20 20), (15 15, 30 15))
A MultiPolygon with two Polygon values: MULTIPOLYGON(((0 0,10 0,10 10,0 10,0 0)),((5 5,7 5,7 7,5 7, 5 5)))
A GeometryCollection consisting of two Point values and one LineString: GEOMETRYCOLLECTION(POINT(10 10), POINT(30 30), LINESTRING(15 15, 20 20))

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a Well-known text representation to a .
member.param: A tagged text string ( see the OpenGIS Simple Features Specification.
member.returns: Returns a specified by wellKnownText. Throws an exception if there is a parsing problem.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT.Parse(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Converts a Well-known Text representation to a .
member.param: A Reader which will return a Geometry Tagged Text string (see the OpenGIS Simple Features Specification)
member.returns: Returns a read from StreamReader. An exception will be thrown if there is a parsing problem.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT.GetCoordinates(SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.WktStreamTokenizer)
member.summary: Returns the next array of Coordinates in the stream.
member.param: Tokenizer over a stream of text in Well-known Text format. The next element returned by the stream should be "(" (the beginning of "(x1 y1, x2 y2, ..., xn yn)" or "EMPTY".
member.returns: The next array of Coordinates in the stream, or an empty array of "EMPTY" is the next element returned by the stream.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT.GetNextNumber(SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.WktStreamTokenizer)
member.summary: Returns the next number in the stream.
member.param: Tokenizer over a stream of text in Well-known text format. The next token must be a number.
member.returns: Returns the next number in the stream.
member.remarks: ParseException is thrown if the next token is not a number.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT.GetNextEmptyOrOpener(SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.WktStreamTokenizer)
member.summary: Returns the next "EMPTY" or "(" in the stream as uppercase text.
member.param: Tokenizer over a stream of text in Well-known Text format. The next token must be "EMPTY" or "(".
member.returns: the next "EMPTY" or "(" in the stream as uppercase text.
member.remarks: ParseException is thrown if the next token is not "EMPTY" or "(".

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT.GetNextCloserOrComma(SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.WktStreamTokenizer)
member.summary: Returns the next ")" or "," in the stream.
member.param: tokenizer over a stream of text in Well-known Text format. The next token must be ")" or ",".
member.returns: Returns the next ")" or "," in the stream.
member.remarks: ParseException is thrown if the next token is not ")" or ",".

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryFromWKT.GetNextCloser(SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.WktStreamTokenizer)
member.summary: Returns the next ")" in the stream.
member.param: Tokenizer over a stream of text in Well-known Text format. The next token must be ")".
member.returns: Returns the next ")" in the stream.
member.remarks: ParseException is thrown if the next token is not ")".

member.summary: Returns the next word in the stream as uppercase text.
member.param: Tokenizer over a stream of text in Well-known Text format. The next token must be a word.
member.returns: Returns the next word in the stream as uppercase text.
member.remarks: Exception is thrown if the next token is not a word.

member.summary: Creates a Geometry using the next token in the stream.

member.returns: Returns a Geometry specified by the next token in the stream.

member.name: F:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.WkbByteOrder.Xdr
member.summary: XDR (Big Endian) Encoding of Numeric Types

remarks.para: The XDR representation of an Unsigned Integer is Big Endian (most significant byte first).
The XDR representation of a Double is Big Endian (sign bit is first byte).

member.name: F:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.WkbByteOrder.Ndr
member.summary: NDR (Little Endian) Encoding of Numeric Types

remarks.para: The NDR representation of an Unsigned Integer is Little Endian (least significant byte first).
The NDR representation of a Double is Little Endian (sign bit is last byte).

member.name: M:SharpMap.Utilities.Wfs.GeometryFactory.initializeSeparators
member.summary: This method initializes separator variables for parsing coordinates. From GML specification: Coordinates can be included in a single string, but there is no facility for validating string content. The value of the 'cs' attribute is the separator for coordinate values, and the value of the 'ts' attribute gives the tuple separator (a single space by default); the default values may be changed to reflect local usage.

member.summary: Calculates Affine and Helmert transformation using Least-Squares Regression of input and output points

member.summary: Initialize Least Squares transformations

member.summary: Adds an input and output value pair to the collection

member.summary: Removes input and output value pair at the specified index

member.summary: Gets the input point value at the specified index

member.summary: Sets the input point value at the specified index

member.summary: Gets the output point value at the specified index

member.summary: Sets the output point value at the specified index

member.name: M:SharpMap.Utilities.LeastSquaresTransform.GetAffineTransformation
member.summary: Return an array with the six affine transformation parameters {a,b,c,d,e,f} and the sum of the squares of the residuals (s0)
member.remarks:
a,b defines scale vector 1 of coordinate system, d,e scale vector 2. c,f defines offset.
Converting from input (X,Y) to output coordinate system (X',Y') is done by: X' = a*X + b*Y + c, Y' = d*X + e*Y + f
Transformation based on Mikhail "Introduction to Modern Photogrammetry" p. 399-300. Extended to arbitrary number of measurements by M. Nielsen
member.returns: Array with the six transformation parameters and sum of squared residuals: a,b,c,d,e,f,s0

member.name: M:SharpMap.Utilities.LeastSquaresTransform.GetHelmertTransformation
member.summary: Calculates the four helmert transformation parameters {a,b,c,d} and the sum of the squares of the residuals (s0)

remarks.para: a,b defines scale vector 1 of coordinate system, d,e scale vector 2. c,f defines offset.
Converting from input (X,Y) to output coordinate system (X',Y') is done by: X' = a*X + b*Y + c, Y' = -b*X + a*Y + d
This is a transformation initially based on the affine transformation but slightly simpler.

member.returns: Array with the four transformation parameters, and sum of squared residuals: a,b,c,d,s0

member.summary: Creates an n x m matrix of doubles

member.name: M:SharpMap.Rendering.VectorRenderer.LimitValues(System.Drawing.PointF[],System.Single)
member.summary: Purpose of this method is to prevent the 'overflow error' exception in the FillPath method. This Exception is thrown when the coordinate values become too big (values over -2E+9f always throw an exception, values under 1E+8f seem to be okay). This method limits the coordinates to the values given by the second parameter (plus an minus). Theoretically the lines to and from these limited points are not correct but GDI+ paints incorrect even before that limit is reached.
member.param: The vertices that need to be limited
The limit at which coordinate values will be cutoff

member.remarks: The WmsLayer is currently very basic and doesn't support automatic fetching of the WMS Service Description. Instead you would have to add the nessesary parameters to the URL, and the WmsLayer will set the remaining BoundingBox property and proper requests that changes between the requests. See the example below.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownText.GeometryToWKT
member.summary: Outputs the textual representation of a instance.
member.remarks:
The Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of Geometry is designed to exchange geometry data in ASCII form. Examples of WKT representations of geometry objects are:
Geometry WKT Representation
A Point POINT(15 20)
Note that point coordinates are specified with no separating comma.
A LineString with four points: LINESTRING(0 0, 10 10, 20 25, 50 60)
A Polygon with one exterior ring and one interior ring: POLYGON((0 0,10 0,10 10,0 10,0 0),(5 5,7 5,7 7,5 7, 5 5))
A MultiPoint with three Point values: MULTIPOINT(0 0, 20 20, 60 60)
A MultiLineString with two LineString values: MULTILINESTRING((10 10, 20 20), (15 15, 30 15))
A MultiPolygon with two Polygon values: MULTIPOLYGON(((0 0,10 0,10 10,0 10,0 0)),((5 5,7 5,7 7,5 7, 5 5)))
A GeometryCollection consisting of two Point values and one LineString: GEOMETRYCOLLECTION(POINT(10 10), POINT(30 30), LINESTRING(15 15, 20 20))

member.name: T:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.GeometryFromWKB
member.summary: Converts Well-known Binary representations to a instance.

remarks.para: The Well-known Binary Representation for (WKBGeometry) provides a portable representation of a value as a contiguous stream of bytes. It permits values to be exchanged between an ODBC client and an SQL database in binary form.

The Well-known Binary Representation for is obtained by serializing a instance as a sequence of numeric types drawn from the set {Unsigned Integer, Double} and then serializing each numeric type as a sequence of bytes using one of two well defined, standard, binary representations for numeric types (NDR, XDR). The specific binary encoding (NDR or XDR) used for a geometry byte stream is described by a one byte tag that precedes the serialized bytes. The only difference between the two encodings of geometry is one of byte order, the XDR encoding is Big Endian, the NDR encoding is Little Endian.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.GeometryFromWKB.Parse(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a from the supplied byte[] containing the Well-known Binary representation.
member.param: byte[] containing the Well-known Binary representation.
member.returns: A bases on the supplied Well-known Binary representation.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Converters.WellKnownBinary.GeometryFromWKB.Parse(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Creates a based on the Well-known binary representation.
member.param: A BinaryReader used to read the Well-known binary representation.
member.returns: A based on the Well-known binary representation.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Data.Providers.MsSql
member.summary: Microsoft SQL data provider

remarks.para: The SQL data table MUST contain five data columns: A binary or image column (a Geometry Column) for storing WKB formatted geometries, and four real values holding the boundingbox of the geometry. These must be named: Envelope_MinX, Envelope_MinY, Envelope_MaxX and Envelope_MaxY. Any extra columns will be returns as feature data.
For creating a valid MS SQL datatable for SharpMap, see for creating and uploading a datasource to MS SQL Server.

members.member:
Initializes a new connection to MS Sql Server
Connectionstring Name of data table Name of geometry column /// Name of column with unique identifier

member.summary: Opens the datasource

member.summary: Closes the datasource

member.summary: Returns geometry Object IDs whose bounding box intersects 'bbox'

member.name: M:SharpMap.Data.Providers.MsSql.CreateDataTable(SharpMap.Data.Providers.IProvider,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new table in a Microsoft SQL Server database and copies rows from an existing datasource.

remarks.para: The datatable created will contain six extra columns besides the attribute data: "OID" (Object ID row), "WKB_Geometry" (Geometry stored as WKB), and Envelope_MinX, Envelope_MinY, Envelope_MaxX, Envelope_MaxY for geometry bounding box.

member.param: Name of table to create (existing table will be overwritten!)
member.returns: Number or rows inserted, -1 if failed and 0 if table created but no rows inserted.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Web.Wms.WmsServer
member.summary: This is a helper class designed to make it easy to create a WMS Service

member.name: M:SharpMap.Web.Wms.WmsServer.ParseQueryString(SharpMap.Map,SharpMap.Web.Wms.Capabilities.WmsServiceDescription,System.Int32,SharpMap.Web.Wms.WmsServer.InterSectDelegate)
member.summary: Generates a WMS 1.3.0 compliant response based on a and the current HttpRequest.

remarks.para: The Web Map Server implementation in SharpMap requires v1.3.0 compatible clients, and support the basic operations "GetCapabilities" and "GetMap" as required by the WMS v1.3.0 specification. SharpMap does not support the optional GetFeatureInfo operation for querying.

member.param: Delegate for Getfeatureinfo intersecting, when null, the WMS will default to ICanQueryLayer implementation

remarks.para: The Web Map Server implementation in SharpMap requires v1.3.0 compatible clients, and support the basic operations "GetCapabilities" and "GetMap" as required by the WMS v1.3.0 specification. SharpMap does not support the optional GetFeatureInfo operation for querying.

member.name: T:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiPolygon
member.summary: A MultiPolygon is a MultiSurface whose elements are Polygons.

member.name: M:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiPolygon.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a MultiPolygon

member.name: M:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiPolygon.IsEmpty
member.summary: If true, then this Geometry represents the empty point set, , for the coordinate space.
member.returns: Returns 'true' if this Geometry is the empty geometry

member.name: M:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiPolygon.IsSimple
member.summary: Returns 'true' if this Geometry has no anomalous geometric points, such as self intersection or self tangency. The description of each instantiable geometric class will include the specific conditions that cause an instance of that class to be classified as not simple.
member.returns: true if the geometry is simple

member.name: M:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiPolygon.Boundary
member.summary: Returns the closure of the combinatorial boundary of this Geometry. The combinatorial boundary is defined as described in section 3.12.3.2 of [1]. Because the result of this function is a closure, and hence topologically closed, the resulting boundary can be represented using representational geometry primitives
member.returns: Closure of the combinatorial boundary of this Geometry

member.name: M:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiPolygon.Distance(SharpMap.Geometries.Geometry)
member.summary: Returns the shortest distance between any two points in the two geometries as calculated in the spatial reference system of this Geometry.
member.returns: Shortest distance between any two points in the two geometries

member.name: M:SharpMap.Geometries.MultiPolygon.Buffer(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a geometry that represents all points whose distance from this Geometry is less than or equal to distance. Calculations are in the Spatial Reference System of this Geometry.
